svcprocinfo.para: The limits listed below are the maximum and default values for the service internal function. Through the use of the EST tool these limits can be adjusted downward for specific customer needs, but not above the recommended factory service interval.

svcsubproc.title: Service Interval Parameters
svcsubproc.para: This group of parameters customizes the Service Interval feature. Service Interval allows the vehicle owner to customize when his vehicle requires servicing as in changing oil. When the programmed distance or engine hour has been reached the Change Oil Lamp will illuminate to indicate its time for maintenance and service.

item.para: This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if this vehicle has the service interval feature.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of fuel used since the last service before lighting the Change Oil Lamp.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of Engine Hours since the last service before lighting the Change Oil Lamp.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of Distance miles/kilometers since the last service before lighting the Change Oil Lamp.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates at what percentage of the service intervals should the Change Oil Lamp begin to flash as a warning.
This parameter indicates if the Change Oil Lamp is to be always on after an engine start.
This parameter indicates how long to activate the Change Oil Lamp after an engine start if it is not always on.
This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if the vehicle has been serviced and the starting values are to be reset.

para.emph: CHANGE OIL LAMP OCC SELF TEST FAIL

svcsubproc.para: Flash Code 262 is caused by an open or short to ground or power in the Change Oil Lamp circuit. It is detected during a Standard Engine Off test when an Output Circuit check is automatically performed. The Engine Standard test may be requested with the EST tool or displayed as a "Flash" code if the diagnostic button is pressed in and the ignition key is turned to the "ON" position. (See the mechanical diagnostic section for complete details on how to perform a key on engine off standard test.
